Package general

Class Simulator

java.lang.Object
general.Simulator
public class Simulator extends Object
Orchestrates the execution of the store simulation, initializing the simulation environment, generating customers, scheduling their arrival events, and processing events through the event queue. This class ties together the store's state, the event queue, and the view responsible for output, managing the lifecycle of the simulation from setup to completion.

  • Constructor Details

    • Simulator

      public Simulator(double lambda, int seed, float closeStoreTime, int checkoutsOpen, int maxCapacityInStore, double minPayTime, double maxPayTime, double minPickTime, double maxPickTime, boolean print)
      Constructs a Simulator with specified parameters for the simulation environment. Initializes the store state, generates all customers and their corresponding arrival events, and optionally sets up the view for outputting simulation progress and results.
      Parameters:
      lambda - The average arrival rate of customers.
      seed - The seed for random number generation, ensuring reproducibility.
      closeStoreTime - The time at which the store closes and no new arrivals are processed.
      checkoutsOpen - The number of checkouts available for customers to use.
      maxCapacityInStore - The maximum number of customers that can be in the store at once.
      minPayTime - The minimum time it takes for a customer to complete payment.
      maxPayTime - The maximum time it takes for a customer to complete payment.
      minPickTime - The minimum time it takes for a customer to pick their items.
      maxPickTime - The maximum time it takes for a customer to pick their items.
      print - Flag indicating whether simulation progress and results should be printed.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the simulation, processing events from the event queue until it is empty, indicating that the simulation has concluded. Finally, stops the store's state.

    • getMissedCustomers

      public int getMissedCustomers()
      Retrieves the number of customers who were missed (could not be served) during the simulation.
      Returns:
      The total number of missed customers.
